treatment.reference: Picrophilus oshimae and Picrophilus torridus fam. nov., gen. nov., sp. nov., Two Species of Hyperacidophilic, Thermophilic, Heterotrophic, Aerobic Archaea IJSB 46:814-816
treatment.description: Obligately aerobic, heterotrophic, moderately thermophilic, hyperacidophilic, irregular cocci. Grows at temperatures between 47 and 65°C and optimally at 60°C. Grows at pH values between about 0 and 3.5 and optimally at pH 0.7. Grows in the presence of 0.1 to 0.5% yeast extract and optimally in the presence of 0.2% yeast extract; a lag phase occurs in the presence of 0.5% yeast extract. Unable to grow by fermentation or chemolithoautotrophically by formation of H2S from sulfur and hydrogen or by sulfur respiration. Under optimal conditions, the generation time is 6 h. Slow growth to a low density occurs on tryptone, and no growth occurs on many other carbon sources. The diameter of the cells is about 1 µm. Division occurs by constriction. There is a regular filigree teragonal S layer, which probably has polysaccharide chains on the outside. Large cavities, apparently not separated from the cytoplasm by a membrane, often are observed in sections. The lattice constant of the S layer is 20 nm. No pili or flagellae are observed. The bis-phytanyl tetraetherlipids are dominated by a single phosphoglycolipid component. The G+C content of the DNA is 36 mol%. Grows significantly faster than P. oshimae. No plasmid is present.
